entry.title: 心有山海，静而无边
entry.content: He Wishes for the Cloths of Heaven Had I the heaven’s embroidered cloths, Enwrought with golden and silver light, The blue and the dim and the dark cloths, Of night and light and the half-light, I would spread the cloths under your feet, But I, being poor, have only my dreams, I have spread my dreams under your feet, Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
